content.description:
Sit Start at the start jug of The Ballad of Mr. H V2- and traverse left using small crimps and a sloper and end at the top out of Allie's Route V0. 

  This route has small crimps and the use of a heel hook will aid the fight to stop from barn dooring off the crux. The crux comes right after your left hand leaves the starting jug.  

  There will be different ways to do this problem depending on how tall you are and being short might be a disadvantage.
content.location: Start on the starting jug of The Ballad of Mr. H V2- and traverse the face ending at the top of Allie's Route V0.

content.description: This route is short and sharp, and it is comprised only a few moves, but these moves are fun and pack a punch. Start on an excellent starting hold and excellent feet, stand up to a good gaston in the white quartz. From here move your feet up and move right hand to the sharp sloper right below the gaston. Get situated for the crux move, once comfortable make long move up to a small crimp up and right, sticking this crimp is the crux, once on the crimp get higher feet and move go to the good top out. Being short might be a distinct disadvantage on the crux move, but may help in moving your feet up before the move.
content.location: When approaching Black Jack Boulders you first see the Entrance Boulders to the right of this is the Blue Trail, walk down this trail 40 yards and there will be a small mossy boulder on the right walk past this boulder and look back at it there is a tall face (12-13 feet) this route starts just left of the mossy right arete.

content.description:
Sit Start on two small crimps and make a deadpoint crux move up to a good full pad crimp with your right hand. After sticking that move bring your left hand up to a knob at the same height and then make a few more mellower moves to the easy top out. 

  The rock is still pretty sharp but it is a good way for beginners to learn how to deadpoint because the crimp you go to during the crux is thankfully smooth.
content.location: The route starts about 10-15 feet left of the obvious jug start to  The Ballad of Mr. H V2- on two crimps about 2-3 feet off the ground. The route climbs straight up.

content.description: A short boulder that is located about 50 yards from the Entrance Boulders. It is located on the right side of the  Blue Flag Trail and when approaching it looks like a mossy unclimbable boulder but when you walk by it there is a taller face about 12 feet at the high point and the routes are all located on this face.
